subclusters.subcluster_name: Immune Surveillance and SASP Interaction Senescence Theory
Dual Role Physiological and Pathological Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of senescent cells and their SASP secretion driving inflammation and tissue dysfunction.
Highlights dysregulation of alternative splicing as a molecular mechanism driving senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Surveillance and SASP Interaction Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes the interplay between senescent cells, SASP, and immune system decline affecting aging.
Focuses on therapeutic removal of senescent cells (senolysis) to delay aging and disease.
Centers on oxidative stress as a key initiator of senescence and role of redox regulators like Nrf1α.
Describes senescence accumulation in brain cells contributing to neurodegenerative aging diseases.
Focuses on senescence accumulation in hepatic cells driving liver aging and pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammation and SASP-Driven Vascular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights SASP-mediated chronic inflammation promoting vascular aging and atherosclerosis.
Emphasizes senolytic removal of senescent cells to improve healthspan and mitigate aging.
Focuses on environmental factors like PM2.5 accelerating senescence via multiple cellular damage mechanisms.
Describes senescence as tumor suppressor mechanism with aging trade-offs due to accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Programmed Cellular Senescence and Regeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence as a regulated process with dual roles in tissue repair and aging pathology.
Links age-related autophagy decline to accumulation of damaged components and senescence.
Focuses on SASP secretion disrupting tissue homeostasis and promoting systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Dual Role Physiological and Pathological Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cells’ beneficial and detrimental roles in physiology and aging.
Emphasizes SASP as a driver of chronic inflammation and age-related diseases with therapeutic targeting.
Shows suppression of autophagy directly induces senescence and organ aging, with senolytic rescue.
Details molecular pathways regulating senescence and SASP contributing to tissue dysfunction and aging.
Focuses on p53/p21 pathway activation inducing senescence and driving organ aging and disease.
Links autophagy regulation via GSK-3β-Ulk1 pathway to cardiomyocyte senescence and cardiac aging.
Highlights Ca2+/calmodulin signaling dysregulation as a modulator of senescence and aging phenotypes.
Focuses on telomere shortening as a causal trigger of senescence and systemic aging.
Describes senescent cell accumulation and SASP impairing musculoskeletal tissue regeneration and function.
Uses Drosophila model to study senescence accumulation and SASP effects on aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Dual Role Physiological and Pathological Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses context-dependent beneficial and detrimental effects of senescent cells and SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Surveillance and SASP Interaction Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on immune system clearance of senescent cells and immune senescence affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Surveillance and SASP Interaction Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights immune system role in modulating SASP effects and senescent cell clearance in aging.
